description:
This course surveys American literature, chiefly of the U.S., from the nineteenth, twentieth, and twenty-first centuries. Different versions of this course will concentrate on different genres and themes, but most will cover a wide range of major authors, such as Cooper, Poe, Melville, Stowe, Whitman, Twain, James, Wharton, Stein, Eliot, Hurston, Faulkner, Ellison, O'Connor, Nabakov, De Lillo, Rich, Pynchon, Ashbery, Roth, McCarthy, and Morrison. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of the current offerings.
name: AMER LIT AFTER THE 1800: AMERICAN BESTSELLERS
